org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon
Class RadialBusyIcon

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon.AbstractBusyIcon
          org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon.DecoratorBusyIcon
              org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon.RadialBusyIcon
All Implemented Interfaces:
Icon, BusyIcon
public class RadialBusyIcon
extends DecoratorBusyIcon

BusyIcon drawing a radial progress bar (circle) below the decorated icon

Some methods can be used for customize the LaF of this icon:

  • DecoratorBusyIcon.setDecoratedIcon(Icon) : Define the basic icon to draw
  • setProgressBarDiameter(int) : Define the diameter of the progress bar (the bar is centered on this icon)
  • setProgressBarThickness(int) : Define the thickness of the progress bar
  • setProgressBarBackground(java.awt.Paint) : Define the background color of the progress bar
  • setProgressBarForeground(java.awt.Paint) : Define the foreground color of the progress bar
Theses methods defines some customization of the LaF's icon. Because some of theses define or depends of some locations or size parameters, they should be set at initialization time and not be updated elsewhere.

The default LaF is installed when no customization is set.
Theses defaults parameters can be overrided by subclasses for provide new oness:

  • installDefaults(): Install default settings

If you need to change in a more depth the painting process, you can as the last step, to override our delegates paint's methods:

  • DecoratorBusyIcon.paintDecoratedIcon(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int) : Paint the basic icon
  • paintProgressBar(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, boolean) : Paint the empty progress bar
  • paintProgressBarAdvance(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, boolean, float, float) : Paint the progress bar advance

Since:
1.1
Author:
André Sébastien (divxdede)

Implement undeterminate rendering by drawing a cyclic turn of the progress bar advance.
This method is marked final and can't be overrided.
If you want customize the painting process, you should override theses methods:
  • DecoratorBusyIcon.paintDecoratedIcon(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int)
  • paintProgressBar(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, boolean)

paintProgressBarAdvance

protected void paintProgressBarAdvance(Component c,
                                       Graphics g,
                                       boolean determinate,
                                       float start,
                                       float end)
Paint the progress bar advance of this icon.

Parameters:
c - Component to paint on
g - Graphics to paint on
determinate - Indicate if the progress bar is in a determinate state or not
start - Start of the advance in a ratio (0f = at the start of the progress bar, 0.5f = at the midle of the progress bar, 1.0f = at the end of the progress bar)
end - End of the advance in a ratio (0f = at the start of the progress bar, 0.5f = at the midle of the progress bar, 1.0f = at the end of the progress bar)

getSignificantRatioOffset

protected float getSignificantRatioOffset()
Description copied from class: AbstractBusyIcon
Return the minimum advance to reach by the BoundedRangeModel between two paint's requests in order to discard the current buffer image (cache) and update this icon with the current state.

The BoundedRangeModel can have a large length between it's minimum and maximum values. When this length is large, this icon may receive a lot of repaint's events.
All of theses event's should not be forwarded if theses event's don't perform a significant difference into this icon.

By exemple, a progress bar of 50 pixels should serve a repaint event if some pixels changes. The significant ratio offset should be 1/50 = 0.02f
In this case, this icon will be updated each time at least a pixel change inside the progress bar.

If you render a progress bar with a radial representation, typically you can return a significant ratio offset of 1/360.
In this case, this icon will be updated each time at least a degree change inside the radial representation.

This information are used only in conjunction of the buffer image provided with AbstractBusyIcon.useCache() and AbstractBusyIcon.setUseCache(boolean) methods.
If the image cache is disabled, all repaint events notified by the BoundedRangeModel will be forwarded.

Specified by:
getSignificantRatioOffset in class AbstractBusyIcon
Returns:
Minimum ratio offset that must be reach by the BoundedRangeModel between to paint processes. Can be set to 0 for serve all paint's requests
See Also:
AbstractBusyIcon.useCache(), AbstractBusyIcon.setUseCache(boolean), AbstractBusyIcon.getRatio()
